session_summary: Deborah and Jolene caught up at 5:35 pm on 22 March, 2023. They discussed Jolene's struggle with exams and deadlines. Jolene mentioned using the Pomodoro Technique and shared her difficulty in prioritizing tasks. Deborah suggested the Eisenhower Matrix for organizing tasks. They also talked about Jolene's dream of learning to surf. Deborah encouraged her to take the first steps and keep pushing herself. Jolene felt motivated and thanked Deborah for the support.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Hey Jolene, it's been a while. Hope you're doing okay with all your exams and deadlines. I know it's difficult for you right now.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Hey Deb! Yeah, it can be tough. Trying to find time for everything is like playing catch-up - really stressful!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: How do you manage your time and stay organized with all the projects and deadlines?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: I'm using the Pomodoro Technique - 25 minutes work, 5-minute break - to avoid burnout but I'm still struggling to prioritize. Do you have any other tips on time management?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a notepad with a list of things to do
conversation_turns.text: I create a daily schedule or to-do list. Here's my example for today.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a notepad with notes on it on a counter
conversation_turns.query: colorful to-do list crossed off tasks
conversation_turns.text: I tried making one but it's kinda overwhelming when it's a big stack of tasks. Here's an example from last Friday.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Have you tried breaking it down or prioritizing the tasks?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: It can often feel overwhelming and difficult to figure out where to start.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: I get it, Jolene. When I'm overloaded, I use a certain method. It helps me figure out what's important and urgent so I'm more organized. Do you know about it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Nah, I'm not familiar with that one. What's it about?

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Want me to tell you about it? It helps you organize things based on how important and urgent they are.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Sure, tell me more about it! It sounds useful.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a pair of scissors sitting on top of a piece of paper
conversation_turns.text: The Eisenhower Matrix sorts tasks into four boxes, categorizing them based on their urgency and importance. It can be really useful for organizing and prioritizing. Here's a breakdown.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: The visualization is helpful too. Thanks for sharing!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: I am glad, it was helpful. Let's give it a try and see if it helps you stay focused and less stressed.

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Yeah, I'll give it a go. Fingers crossed it'll help me. Thanks for the help!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a person walking on the beach with a surfboard
conversation_turns.text: Don't forget to take it easy and look after yourself. Wishing you all the best! Recently, Anna and I were sitting by the sea, watching the sunset and talking about each other. And we realized that we inspire each other. What thoughts does the sea in this photo make you think of?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: This gets me thinking of when I'll learn to surf. Gotta find that spare time!

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Surfing, huh Jolene? Chase your dreams, don't be daunted. Have you thought about the steps you can take?

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Definitely! I've been gathering information, watching videos, and I even got a beginners' guide to surfing. Just need to find the right time and place to get a lesson.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a row of surfboards leaning against a palm tree
conversation_turns.text: Way to go! Taking those first steps is key. Believe in yourself and keep going!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks for the support! Those got me pumped to try surfing. Gonna keep pushing myself to make it happen.

conversation_turns.speaker: Deborah
conversation_turns.text: Keep it up, Jolene! Remember, the experience matters just as much as the end result. Step by step and have fun along the way. You can do it!

conversation_turns.speaker: Jolene
conversation_turns.text: Thanks for the boost!

Deborah: Deborah and her neighbor-friend, Anna, bond during a moment at the beach and inspire each other about pursuing their dreams.
Deborah is familiar with the Pomodoro Technique for time management.
Deborah creates a daily schedule or to-do list to stay organized.
Deborah is aware of the Eisenhower Matrix for organizing and prioritizing tasks based on urgency and importance.
Deborah recently sat by the sea with Anna, watching the sunset and talking about inspiring each other.
Jolene: Jolene finds it difficult to manage time and stay organized during exams and deadlines.
Jolene uses the Pomodoro Technique - 25 minutes work, 5-minute break - to avoid burnout.
Jolene struggles to prioritize tasks even with the Pomodoro Technique.
Jolene finds daily schedules or to-do lists overwhelming when dealing with a big stack of tasks.
Jolene is interested in learning about new time management methods like the Eisenhower Matrix shared by Deborah.
Jolene is planning on learning to surf, has been gathering information, and got a beginners' guide to surfing.
